turn.0: ELI5: In movies when people are dying, the person that cares for them tells them not to waste energy talking, is it realistic for that last little amount of energy spent talking to be the difference between life and death?
turn.1: My mom was in hospice for 6 days. During that time her energy was real low bc she was dying. Talking was too much and we often told her it was ok not to. She wanted to talk but it was hard.  We asked yes or no questions for her to nod too.
turn.2: So it was ok with her not to talk as well?
turn.3: I mean she was coming to terms with death...I’m sure she become “ok” with all kinds of things.   It wasn’t that she shouldn’t talk but rather she couldn’t talk.
turn.4: Right I’m sorry. That was insensitive.
turn.5: Not really - my first response was a bit wordy and not to the point.  It’s cool. I’m not sensitive
